lumpyrem.lumprem module¶

class lumpyrem.lumprem.Model(model_name, silofile=False, workspace=False)¶

Bases: object

get_results()¶

Returns a Pandas dataframe of model results and parameters from the Simulation object.

run_model()¶
write_irigfile(numdays, irrig_start, fracyear, irrigfile='irrig.in', irrig_end=None, date_start='01/01/1900')¶
write_model(file=False, numdays=100, noutdays=None, nstep=1, mxiter=100, tol=1e-05, rbuf=[0.0], mbuf=[0.0])¶

rbuf: the recharge delay buffer. List of volumes assumed to have left soil moisture on previous days. First lelement left soil moisture on preivous day. Second element two days previously, etc. mbuf: the macropore delay buffer. Same setup as rbuf.

lumpyrem.lumprep module¶

class lumpyrem.lumprep.Simulation(model_list, start_date='01/01/2000', end_date='31/12/2010', steps_per_day=1, nday_out='monthly', batch_file='run.bat', pest_control_file='temp.pst', silofile='silofile.txt', 'evap')¶

Bases: object

get_results()¶

Returns a Pandas dataframe of model results and parameters from the Simulation object.

run_simulation()¶

Runs LUMPREM on models created using LUMPREP in the Simulation object.

write_simulation(infile='lumprep.in')¶

lumpyrem.post module¶

lumpyrem.post.read_tsfile(filename)¶

Reads a MODFLOW6 timeseries file and return timeries as rec array.

INPUT file: path to file.

RETURNS a: rec array of timesteps and timeseries values

lumpyrem.run module¶

lumpyrem.run.run_process(process, path=False, commands=[], print_output=True)¶

This calls a process and then executes a list of commands INPUT:

Process: String name of process to execute. Process needs to be added to environmental path or exe in same folder. Path: directory where input and output files are stored. Commands: list of strings with input commands in sequence.
